title: Girl raped, killed in Cagayan
text:
Girl raped, killed in Cagayan By Raymund Catindig (The Philippine Star) | Updated March 21, 2017 - 12:00am 
TUGUEGARAO CITY, Philippines â€“ The decomposing body of a 10-year-old girl believed to be a victim of rape was found in a cornfield in Barangay Sta. Clara in Sta. Ana, Cagayan on Sunday. 
Revelyn Talaro, a Grade 5 student, was reported missing four days earlier, said Chief Inspector Saturnino Soriano, Sta. Ana police chief. 
Soriano said medico-legal officers could not confirm if the victim was raped because animals apparently ate her genitals. The head of the girl was bashed with a hard object. 
Two men were invited for questioning. 
Meanwhile, laborer Stanley Amoga, 25, was arrested for allegedly raping a four-year-old girl in Barangay Ammacian in Pinukpuk, Kalinga last year. 
Amoga, who was ranked fourth on the list of most wanted persons in Kalinga, was arrested based on a warrant issued by Tabuk City Regional Trial Court Judge Marcelino Wacas Ngis-o.
